title: COUNT PAREN
text:
You are given a boolean expression consisting of a string of the symbols 'true', 'false', 'and', 'or', and 'xor'. Count the number of ways to parenthesize the expression such that it will evaluate to true."and", "or" and "xor" are of the same priority.InputAn integer t, 1 ≤ t ≤ 100, denoting the number of test cases, followed by t lines, each containing a space separated string consisting of T, F, and, or and xor of length less than 100 charactersOutputFor each string given at input, display a line with the number of ways to parenthesize the expression such that it will evaluate to true.ExampleInput:1
T and FOutput:0
